name: BRCA1
summary: This gene encodes a nuclear phosphoprotein that plays a role in maintaining genomic stability, and it also acts as a tumor suppressor. The encoded protein combines with other tumor suppressors, DNA damage sensors, and signal transducers to form a large multi-subunit protein complex known as the BRCA1-associated genome surveillance complex (BASC). This gene product associates with RNA polymerase II, and through the C-terminal domain, also interacts with histone deacetylase complex.
expression: Broad expression in bone marrow, lymph node and 25 other tissues

name: BRCA2
summary: This gene encodes a protein which is involved in the repair of chromosomal damage with an important role in the error-free repair of DNA double strand breaks. The protein is involved in homologous recombination repair, and it interacts with the ssDNA-binding protein RAD51.
expression: Broad expression in bone marrow, lymph node and 24 other tissues

name: TP53
summary: This gene encodes a tumor suppressor protein containing transcriptional activation, DNA binding, and oligomerization domains. The encoded protein responds to diverse cellular stresses to regulate expression of target genes, thereby inducing cell cycle arrest, apoptosis, senescence, DNA repair, or changes in metabolism.
expression: Broad expression in bone marrow, appendix and 25 other tissues

name: CFTR
summary: This gene encodes a member of the ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporter superfamily. The encoded protein functions as a chloride channel, controlling ion and water transport across epithelial cell membranes. Mutations in this gene cause cystic fibrosis, one of the most common lethal genetic diseases.
expression: Biased expression in lung, small intestine and 4 other tissues

name: EGFR
summary: This gene encodes the receptor for members of the epidermal growth factor family. EGFR is a cell surface protein that binds to epidermal growth factor, thus inducing receptor dimerization and tyrosine autophosphorylation leading to cell proliferation. Mutations in this gene are associated with lung cancer.
expression: Biased expression in skin, placenta and 5 other tissues

name: APOE
summary: This gene encodes a major apoprotein of the chylomicron. It binds to a specific receptor on liver and peripheral cells and is essential for the normal catabolism of triglyceride-rich lipoprotein constituents. The APOE4 variant is the largest known genetic risk factor for late-onset sporadic Alzheimer disease.
expression: Biased expression in liver, brain and 3 other tissues

name: KRAS
summary: This gene encodes a protein that is a member of the small GTPase superfamily. A single amino acid substitution results in an activating mutation. The transforming protein that results is implicated in various malignancies, including lung adenocarcinoma, mucinous adenoma, and pancreatic carcinoma.
expression: Broad expression in endometrium, lung and 24 other tissues

name: HBB
summary: This gene encodes the beta chain of hemoglobin. The hemoglobin tetramer consists of two alpha chains and two beta chains, which is the most abundant form in adult red blood cells. Mutations in this gene cause sickle cell anemia and beta-thalassemia.
expression: Biased expression in bone marrow (RPKM 7143.1) and reticulocyte (RPKM 485.5)

name: MYC
summary: This gene encodes a multifunctional nuclear phosphoprotein that plays a role in cell cycle progression, apoptosis and cellular transformation. It functions as a transcription factor that regulates transcription of specific target genes. Amplification of this gene is frequently observed in numerous human cancers.
expression: Broad expression in bone marrow, appendix and 22 other tissues

name: PTEN
summary: This gene encodes a phosphatidylinositol-3,4,5-trisphosphate 3-phosphatase that negatively regulates the AKT/PKB signaling pathway. It acts as a tumor suppressor by negatively regulating intracellular levels of phosphatidylinositol-3,4,5-trisphosphate in cells.
expression: Broad expression in brain, endometrium and 25 other tissues

name: JAK2
summary: This gene encodes a non-receptor tyrosine kinase that is involved in various processes such as cell growth, development, differentiation or histone modifications. It mediates essential signaling events in both innate and adaptive immunity. The V617F gain-of-function mutation is found in most patients with polycythemia vera.
expression: Broad expression in bone marrow, lymph node and 23 other tissues

name: RB1
summary: This gene encodes the retinoblastoma protein which is a negative regulator of the cell cycle and was the first tumor suppressor gene found. The encoded protein also stabilizes constitutive heterochromatin to maintain the overall chromatin structure.
expression: Broad expression in bone marrow, lymph node and 25 other tissues

name: APC
description: APC regulator of WNT signaling pathway
summary: This gene encodes a tumor suppressor protein that acts as an antagonist of the Wnt signaling pathway. It is also involved in other processes including cell migration and adhesion, transcriptional activation, and apoptosis. Defects in this gene cause familial adenomatous polyposis (FAP), an autosomal dominant pre-malignant disease.
expression: Broad expression in colon, small intestine and 23 other tissues

name: FBN1
summary: This gene encodes a member of the fibrillin family of proteins. The encoded preproprotein is proteolytically processed to generate the extracellular matrix component fibrillin, which is a large glycoprotein that serves as a structural component of calcium-binding microfibrils. Mutations in this gene are associated with Marfan syndrome and other connective tissue disorders.
expression: Biased expression in aorta, lung and 5 other tissues

name: HFE
summary: This gene encodes a membrane protein that is similar to MHC class I-type proteins and associates with beta-2 microglobulin. It is thought to function in regulating iron absorption by regulating the interaction of the transferrin receptor with transferrin. Mutations in this gene cause hereditary hemochromatosis.
expression: Biased expression in liver, small intestine and 3 other tissues

name: DMD
summary: This gene encodes the dystrophin protein, a large rod-shaped cytoskeletal protein found at the inner surface of muscle fibers. Dystrophin is part of the dystrophin-associated protein complex which spans the sarcolemma. Mutations in this gene cause Duchenne and Becker muscular dystrophies.
expression: Biased expression in heart (RPKM 34.2), skeletal muscle (RPKM 28.7) and brain (RPKM 8.1)
